content: Provide two examples of parallel antithesis in Lincoln's The Gettysburg Address. Pull the examples directly from the text.

chosen:
"government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth." and "a new birth of freedom". 
These are examples of parallel antithesis because they are opposing ideas that are structured in a similar manner.
rejected: "government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth." and "government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth." are both examples of parallel antithesis.
